translations.name: The Bible in Enxet
translations.description: Enxet, sometimes known as Lengua, also exists in a northern form and is spoken as a third language, after Spanish and Guaraní, by around 10,000 people in the Western part of Paraguay. The complete Bible in Northern Enxet was published in 1995, and a translation of the New Testament in Southern Enxet has been available for purchase since 1997. Tim Curtis, working under the auspices of the South American Mission Society in the region for many years reports that many Southern Enxet speakers had never before seen material in their own language. They have been able to use the New Testament for learning to read and write, while “many lives have also been changed through a personal encounter with God.”

translations.name: Biblia Enxet (Lengua Sur)
translations.description: Enxet, sometimes known as Lengua, also exists in a northern form and is spoken as a third language, after Spanish and Guaraní, by around 10,000 people in the Western part of Paraguay. Tim Curtis, working under the auspices of the South American Mission Society in the region for many years reports that many Southern Enxet speakers had never before seen material in their own language. They have been able to use the New Testament for learning to read and write, while “many lives have also been changed through a personal encounter with God.”
